I just did an entire playthrough of this game today in one sitting, it really is THAT short! Took me about 4 Hours to complete if my maths are right. But even so, it still feels like a lot is happening and is well-paced throughout.
So it's still a great fun burst throughout, even if certain moments seem to drag for a while. Maybe not the best Half Life game (and the follow-up Episode 2 is arguably better imo), it's still worth playing through at least once. Though you will ofc need the prior context of HL2 first before jumping in...

(Also the only mainline HL game thus far where you don't have a Crowbar for the majority of your playthrough!)

La expansi√≥n empieza justo en donde quedamos al final de Half-Life 2. Vemos lo qu√© pas√≥ con el n√∫cleo y los estragos que dej√≥, podemos adentrarnos m√°s en Ciudad 17 y encontrarnos con aliados por diferentes zonas enfrent√°ndose a la Alianza, b√°sicamente esta expansi√≥n nos lleva a recorrer la ciudad para buscar una forma de salir de all√≠. Un agregado es que la mayor parte del juego estaremos junto a Alyx, siendo una muy buena compa√±era la cual nos aporta bastante ayuda durante todo el juego.

Much more fun than HL2. The story is more interesting and you can complete it having shot only one bullet, which I tried to do, but APPARENTLY I fired more than once. The game is much more intense without bullets though, haha

Its fun, but short. Its the Blue Shift of Half-Life 2. It improved on very little, had its climax at the start of the game and I find it hard to come back and play again. For Half-Life fans, its essential, a must. But as a gamer its not, and I see it as just a setup for Episode 2, Its story is great, and you need to play it for Episode 2, but I personally just, dont think its nearly as good as the main game, or Episode 2.

Unfortunately after playing replaying HL2 and then replaying this episode I really cannot recommend this compared to the rest. Playing through HL2 is one of the funnest experiences in gaming, its a very near perfect game for me. This game however is not, I spent most of my time being infuriated with its dumb sections and lack of really anything important.

I still say you need to play this if you'll be playing the Half Life series, it does contain infomation you will need to know but also doesn't do a whole lot. But it is certainly the weakest in the series and as a game I don't enjoy.

This game arc centers on the relationship between Gordon and Alyx...that is really worth to play if you like the character of Alyx. I didnt really like the stages of City 17 and that hurts my soul because the original Half-life 2 Stages are so good and much more appealing, Here there were not as memorable as it was originally. Aside from that. Its good...not amazing, just good.
Allyx makes for a great companion. It's good and i love the developer commentary.

So, i finished Half Life 2 Episode One and i have to say i cant recommend this DLC. While it's worth the money round about 7 Euro, the DLC sticks to some mechanics which were poorly made in Half Life 2.

+ There is no difference between Half Life 2 and  HL2 Episode One in a technical way. Graphics, sounds, animations and gunplay is as equal as in HL2. It's kinda aged but get's the job done in terms of immersion and atmosphere.

- The story is banal up to irrelevant. You are just escpaping city 17 with alyx and other obstacles (yes, you read right). But annoying as a plastic chair in a doorframe are the controls, physics and NPCs. You find yourself too often blocked by NPCs which are following you too close. Pushing things like a barrel which blocks half of a doorway is nearly impossible. So you have to pick stuff up with E or constantly swapping to the gravitron to move a cardboard box. It's ridiculous how the DLC forces you to use this thing. Even if you think to shoot all crates, boxes and funnel grids, the DLC finds a little riddle to use the gravitron anyway. Which leads to the next point. You get the Crowbar (Gordons Excalibur!) waaay too late! It's pointles to get it anyway! Some scripted events in a scene got the taste of trolling the player and doesn't add any atmosphere. This is a bitter taste compared to HL1 and HL2.

I'm glad i finished the DLC for once... i dont think it's worth to be replayed.
